metadata.title: CVE-2012-2697 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
Unspecified vulnerability in autofs, as used in Red Hat Enterprise Linux(RHEL) 5, allows local users to cause a denial of service (autofs crash anddelayed mounts) or prevent "mount expiration" via unspecified vectorsrelated to "using an LDAP-based automount map."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-2697` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

autofs - 5.0.7-3ubuntu3.1
autofs-hesiod - 5.0.7-3ubuntu3.1
autofs-ldap - 5.0.7-3ubuntu3.1
autofs5 - 5.0.7-3ubuntu3.1
autofs5-hesiod - 5.0.7-3ubuntu3.1
autofs5-ldap - 5.0.7-3ubuntu3.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: autofs package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.0.7-3ubuntu3.1').
